pageContext.claim: “As you know, we had 32 solar plants, and of the 32, I think 30 were closed, Larry, right? There were -- it's a new industry, but they were getting absolutely killed by China and some others. And we put a tariff on those panels coming in, which were not nearly as good as the ones we make. And now we have two that are open. Can you imagine, of the 32, there were two that are -- were just about limping along and barely open. These two are now doing very well and they're looking to open seven, eight, nine of the plants.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump consistently gets this wrong, saying that the two solar-panel companies that brought a complaint are the only ones remaining in the United States. They are not also seeking to open "seven, eight, nine plants."
